alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 27 at 2:32PM PDT until March 28 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Areas along the Southern Oregon Coast from Cape Blanco southward, including Port Orford, Gold Beach, Pistol River and Brookings. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds are expected this evening into tonight. Winds are expected to briefly lower early Tuesday morning, then increase again by Tuesday afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
